pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
The Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, spoke today with the Prime Minister of Japan Shinzo Abe.

The Prime Ministers repeated their commitment to work together to combat climate change and discussed ways to increase cooperation to support clean and sustainable economic growth.

The leaders also discussed opportunities to advance open and progressive trade.  They also exchanged views on the actions of the Democratic People's Republic of Koreaâ€Ž, which pose serious risks to international peace and security.  

Finally, both leaders undertook to continue their close cooperation, and looked forward to seeing each other at the G20 Summit in Germany.

They reaffirmed their resolve to address regional security concerns and committed to continued collaboration in multilateral organizations such as the G20.
